law.catch_line: To obtain a corrected photo commercial driver's license, an individual shall:...

text.section:
To obtain a corrected photo commercial driver's license, an individual shall:
Apply for a corrected commercial driver's license on the form required by the Administration;
Surrender the individual's original license; and
Pay the required fee.
A corrected photo commercial driver's license shall expire on the date that the individual's original license expired.

If an individual other than one who holds a commercial driver's license desires a corrected photo license in lieu of a correction card for a desired or required correction, the individual shall:
Apply for a corrected photo license on the form required by the Administration;
Surrender the individual's original license; and
Pay the required fee.

section.section: A corrected photo license issued under subsection (c) of this section to a driver at least 21 years old shall expire on the birth date of the licensee in the fifth year following the issuance of the license.
A corrected photo license issued under subsection (c) of this section to a driver under age 21 years shall expire 60 days after the driver's 21st birthday.

text.section: If a licensee applies for a photo license to correct an error made by the Administration, the Administration shall issue the corrected license without charging the licensee a fee.

section.section: If an individual, other than one who holds a commercial driver's license, is temporarily absent from the State and desires a corrected license, the Administration may issue a nonphoto corrected license bearing the notation that it is valid without a photo until 15 days after the licensee first returns to this State.

The licensee shall:
Apply for the corrected license on the form required by the Administration; and
Pay the required fee.
